COMPANY POLICY
It is the policy of Interstate Chemical Company, Inc. to conduct our business in such a manner that risks to our employees, our neighbors, and the environment are minimized.  Despite our best efforts in this regard, it is a fact of business that emergency situations may occur at some point in time.  We must, therefore, be prepared to safely and effectively manage emergency situations in order to prevent escalation of the situation and minimize the risk to ourselves and the community.  To that end, Interstate Chemical Company will: Plan for all emergencies resulting from natural, technological, or human events through active discussion between various departments and personnel, develop and maintain a written Emergency Response Plan that will assist key individuals in the effective management of and response to emergency situations, provide adequate training to all individuals who have responsibilities under the Emergency Response Management Plan.  Training will provide the knowledge and skills needed to safely and effectively respond to various emergencies, Conduct routine drills to evaluate the effectiveness of the Emergency Response Management Plan and critique and revise the plan as necessary, and maintain direct communications and involvement with outside agencies, neighboring businesses and communities with respect to emergency plans and procedures.

Interstate Chemical Company's Emergency Response Policy exists to protect our livelihood in the event that an emergency situation occurs.  We must all adhere to this policy to ensure our safety and success in the future.

DESCRIPTION OF THE FACILITY
Interstate Chemical Company is located in Hermitage, Pennsylvania 1/2 mile northwest of Interstate 80 and Route 18 Interchange.  Interstate Chemical has three buildings onsite; a warehouse, garage, and traffic building.  The facility consists of approximately 15 acres.  The 75,000 square foot warehouse is used to store both bulk and non-bulk chemicals.  We

have over 40 above ground storage tanks to store various chemicals.  Hydrofluoric acid is brought into the facility in 500 pound factory pack drums, no repackaging of this product is performed.  Therefore, the chance for an incident to occur are small and would only occur while handling the drums.  All of the warehouse employees have been trained on drum handling activities, forklift, and spill response.  No incidents have occurred at this facility.

RULES AND REGULATIONS
Interstate Chemical Company has developed an Integrated Contingency Plan which is prepared to incorporate the following Environmental Protection Agency, Occupational Health and Safety Administration, and Pennsylvania Department of Environemtal Protection Agency regulations and standards:  Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response, Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasures Plans, Oil Pollution Act, Facililty Response Plan, Recource Conservation and Recovery Act, Storm Water Pollution Plan, Preparedness Prevention and Contingency Plan, and Storage Tank and Spill Prevention Plan.

The purpose of the Integrated Contingency Plan is to provide facility personnel and emergency personnel with a systematic approach and guidance on how to prevent, manage and respond to releases, of materials into the environment.  The plan identifies the regulated materials and volumes of concern, the parties required to be notified in the event of a release of those materials, the equipement and personnel necessary to control and mitigate an incident, and the tactics and strategies in order to accomplish those tasks.

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
There have been no accidents at this facility in the last 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
Interstate Chemical Company's Emergency Response Plan is part of our Integrated Contingency Plan.  The plan calls for the Interstate Chemical Employees to be trained to the First Responder level only.  All other forms of emergency response will be conducted by Federal, State, or

Local Agencies.  We have relationships set up with outside spill response companies should a spill ever occur at our facility.  If a spill of a reportable quantity were to occur we have a notification list of all regulatory agencies that would need to be notified both local and national.  We have designated employees who will be in charge during emergecny situations.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
Employees at Interstate Chemical Company are continually monitored to assure that they handle materials safely.  Supervisors are instructed to provide additional training should a deficiency occur.  All new employees receive training prior to working in our warehouse.  

To improve the safety of the facility we have placed hydrofluoric acid kits in the warehouse and trained all the employees on the use of that product.  While it is unlikely that we will ever have an incident occur with hydrofluoric acid, we are better prepared to provide first aid should an employee ever get burned.
